summary_about_you: Hung Yin Chen, also known as Kelly, is a highly motivated AI engineer with extensive academic and professional experience in artificial intelligence and machine learning. She is currently pursuing a Master's degree in Engineering with a focus on artificial intelligence at Duke University, with a remarkable GPA of 3.92/4. As an AI researcher at Hera Fertility, she has developed an AI-powered fertility report analysis system and achieved an impressive ROC-AUC score of 0.96 with her model. Kelly is proficient in Python, LLMs, Computer Vision, AWS, Google Cloud, Git, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau. She has a strong analytical mind and a proven ability to work both independently and as part of a team. Her collaborative spirit, detail-oriented approach, and thirst for knowledge make her a perfect fit for Armada's AI/ML team.
why_this_role_interests_you: As an AI researcher with a strong educational background in Artificial Intelligence and hands-on experience in building and fine-tuning machine learning models, I am fascinated by the opportunity to work with Armada. What interests me most about this role is the chance to contribute to projects that are at the forefront of AI and machine learning, especially in the context of edge computing. I am particularly drawn to the prospect of working with large datasets and optimizing model performance, areas where I have gained considerable experience during my time at Hera Fertility and Earthbook. Additionally, the chance to work in a fast-paced environment and collaborate with cross-functional teams aligns perfectly with my experiences and aspirations. I am excited about the prospect of using my skills to further Armada's mission of bridging the digital divide with advanced technology infrastructure.
relevant_projects:
1. Fundus Image Prediction for Diabetic Retinopathy @ Duke Spring 2025: Built computer vision-based deep learning models for diabetic retinopathy detection, improving F1 score by 32% over classical ML models, achieving 0.8214 F1 with VGG16. Applied Explainable AI (Grad-CAM) for model interpretability, measuring Intersection over Union with the expert-labelled dataset, and built a web application for real-time diabetic retinopathy detection.
   
2. RAG-Based Career Guidance System @ Duke Spring 2025: Built a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)-based career guidance system by implementing text processing, semantic search, and retrieval pipelines, improving career insights from diverse resumes.

3. Automated Evaluation of Startup Pitches @ Duke Spring 2025: Developed an AI tool to evaluate startup pitches using GPT-4o scoring and deep learning models (BERT, Llama3.2) on ~500 YC videos. Achieved a QWK score of 0.72 by fine-tuning Llama3.2 with chain-of-thought distillation, outperforming traditional ML approaches by 48%.
technical_skills: Technical skills: Python, R, Java, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, SQL, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision.
career_goals: As an AI engineer, my career goal is to continually advance my expertise in artificial intelligence and machine learning, and apply these skills to create innovative solutions that can bridge the digital divide. I'm specifically interested in edge computing and its potential to bring advanced technology infrastructure to remote areas. I aim to contribute to the development of AI solutions that can process data locally for real-time analytics and machine learning at the edge, providing essential services in areas where connectivity and cloud infrastructure are limited. I'm also keen on staying updated on the latest AI advancements and research papers to ensure that my work is cutting-edge and impactful. I strive to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where I can collaborate with cross-functional teams and apply my problem-solving skills to make a significant difference.
